entry.title: Bang Bang Bunny are sponsored by The Arts Council

link.title: Bang Bang Bunny are sponsored by The Arts Council

entry.content: Bang Bang Bunny are sponsored by The Arts Council England and were awarded the DYCP Grant in 2023 to fuse punk rap with Scottish Gaelic, to popularise an endangered language and history through music. Madaldn, born in Essex, descends from the Elliott Clan. She States “My grandad tells me how his grandad fought in Black Watch, a feared Scottish army battalion, known for their fierce tempers. I’m going to bring that ferocity and culture to my music.“

entry.title: Bang Bang Bunny’s drummer Freddie Rowland

link.title: Bang Bang Bunny’s drummer Freddie Rowland

entry.content: Bang Bang Bunny’s drummer Freddie Rowland, who is in Love Dogz with Big Brother Winner Pete Bennett and Mad Dog Collective says that he is really excited to be in a punk-rap band fronted by an amazing female artist. “I met Madaldn in 2022, and I saw something different and worth investing in. Some people might be put off by the fact that Madaldn is a single mum of two, but I love a MILF. Jokes aside, it isn’t easy as we all live so far apart and have to work within school hours. But we make it happen.”

entry.title: Bang Bang Bunny are supported by That is Class

link.title: Bang Bang Bunny are supported by That is Class

entry.content: That is Class project founder states; “We are looking forward to seeing what Bang Bang Bunny is set to deliver. We know they have some great music set to be released and some tricks up their sleeve. Bang Bang 2023 is going to be their year and we expect to see them on all the big stages.”
